children.title: Vestido
children.description:
Vestido de fiesta de crespón de seda negro con aplicación de mostacillas de pasta vitrea de color dorado, azulado y negro. Cuerpo suelto con escote de pico y ancho tirante. Falda con vuelo de forma ligeramente acampanada y remate inferior formando picos.  
Decoración bordada de formas geométricas lineales de carácter Art Decó.  
Los locos años 20 se definen en indumentaria por el uso de este tipo de vestidos: cortos, para mostrar las piernas, bailar el charleston y el foxtrot, y brillantes, que parecen agitarse con la luz nocturna, para seducir y demostrar la necesidad de vivir intensamente. El tejido, la decoración a base de cuentas de pasta vitrea y la hechura tubular nos remite tipologicamente a los vestidos en uso en la década de los años veinte del siglo XX, sin embargo la ligera forma acamapanada de la falda nos informa de los cambios estructurales que se producirán en la siguiente década.

children.title: Vestido
children.description:
Vestido en crep de seda de color crudo, con tocado de cabeza a juego. Es largo por debajo de la rodilla, con escote alto redondeado en el delantero, manga larga con puño, y corte a la cadera, de línea redondeada en delantero y espalda. El cuerpo es ablusado y la falda fruncida y con aberturas en los costados, que dejan ver la falda interior del mismo tejido. Lleva decoración aplicada de ancho galón, situado sobre el delantero del cuerpo, las aberturas de la falda y el inicio de la manga, realizado con dos tipos de hilo metálico entorchado color plateado. Se completa con un tocado, prolongado en cola, en el extremo superior cerrado a manera de gorro, con decoración aplicada de galón metálico, semejante al del vestido.  
  
Las características de este traje de novia son las propias de la silueta de los años veinte. Tras la liberación del corsé, ahora triunfa una silueta andrógina, joven, con corte a la cadera y línea recta definida por el largo de la falda, que deja ver la parte inferior de la pierna, prefiriendo los tejidos con mucha caída. Son años en los que la influencia de Estados Unidos impregna la forma de vida, a través del cine y los nuevos ritmos, que como el jazz, o el charlestón, amenizan las grandes fiestas y potencian el deseo de vivir intensamente. El traje se adapta a la nueva mujer, emancipada y libre, trabajadora, y con derecho al voto.

It is completed with a headdress, prolonged in tail, at the upper end closed as a cap, with applied decoration of metallic chevron, similar to that of the dress. \\The characteristics of this wedding dress are typical of the silhouette of the twenties. children.description: Devore velvet wedding dress with train, by Debenham & Freebody, London, 1926. Devore velvet wedding dress with attached metal lace train. Drop waist with belt detailing. Dress: silk chiffon velvet. Train: Silk chiffon velvet and metal lace.

Lace may be made with a needle or with bobbins. Embroidery may be added. Modern lace may be made by machine. Openwork fabrics made on a loom and ornamental openwork knitting are generally not classified as lace. Lace is often white or monochromatic. True lace developed in the fourteenth century in Europe and the Middle East, although ornamented openwork fabrics were known in ancient cultures, including the Egyptian culture. children.title: Abito femminile da sera.
children.description: Abito in tulle beige, interamente ricamato con motivi stilizzati in paillettes iridate, cannette di vetro in gradazione dal bianco all'argento e strass. linea sciolta, arricchita da spicchi tagliati in sbieco sotto i fianchi lievemente increspati, scollatura triangolare, orlo festonato, decorazioni ad alette sagomate che ricadono dalle spalle sulla parte superiore degli omeri.

children.title: Byzance
children.description: Evening Dress, Patou, Paris, 1924.  Evening dress made from oyster georgette with low, straight neck and shoulder straps. The bodice is straight cut with a low waist. The skirt is slightly gauged at the back and continues to the front sides. The front skirt consists of a central beaded panel. The dress is embroidered in beads of pink, gold, bronze and baroque pearl. The design entirely covers the bodice and is arranged in panels with floral motifs and a border pattern around the skirt. The shoulder straps and front skirt panel are embroidered in bands. The dress fastens at the left hand side with hooks and eyes and is lined with georgette. Silk, embroidered with glass bugle beads and imitation baroque pearls, lined with georgette and fastened with metal hooks and eyes.

Bronze was made before 3,000 BCE -- possibly as early as 10,000 BCE, although its common use in tools and decorative items is dated only in later artifacts. The proportions of copper and tin vary widely, from 70 to 95 percent copper in surviving ancient artifacts. Because of the copper base, bronze may be very malleable and easy to work. By the Middle Ages in Europe, it was recognized that using the metals in certain proportions could yield specific properties. Some modern bronzes contain no tin at all, substituting other metals such as aluminum, manganese, and even zinc. Historically, the term was used interchangeably with latten. Jean (Designer)"]},"dcDate":{"en":["1924"]},"dcDescription":{"en":["Evening Dress, Patou, Paris, 1924.  Evening dress made from oyster georgette with low, straight neck and shoulder straps. The bodice is straight cut with a low waist. The skirt is slightly gauged at the back and continues to the front sides. The front skirt consists of a central beaded panel. The dress is embroidered in beads of pink, gold, bronze and baroque pearl. The design entirely covers the bodice and is arranged in panels with floral motifs and a border pattern around the skirt. The shoulder straps and front skirt panel are embroidered in bands. The dress fastens at the left hand side with hooks and eyes and is lined with georgette. Silk, embroidered with glass bugle beads and imitation baroque pearls, lined with georgette and fastened with metal hooks and eyes. "]},"dcIdentifier":{"def":["T.198-1970"]},"dcRights":{"en":["©Jean Patou"]},"dcTitle":{"en":["Byzance"]},"dcType":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10232","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10005"],"en":["Object Type: evening gown","Object Type: dress"]},"dctermsCreated":{"en":["1924"]},"dctermsIsPartOf":{"en":["Europeana XX: Century of Change"]},"dctermsProvenance":{"en":["Given by Lord and Lady Cowdray"]},"proxyIn":["/aggregation/provider/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019"],"proxyFor":"/item/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019","edmType":"IMAGE","europeanaProxy":false}],"qualityAnnotations":[{"about":"/item/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019#contentTier","created":"2022-09-30T10:00:05.909659Z","target":["/aggregation/provider/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019","/aggregation/aggregator/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019"],"body":"http://www.europeana.eu/schemas/epf/contentTier1"},{"about":"/item/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019#metadataTier","created":"2022-09-30T10:00:05.909679Z","target":["/aggregation/provider/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019","/aggregation/aggregator/2048213/europeana_fashion_http___collections_vam_ac_uk_item_O75019"],"body":"http://www.europeana.eu/schemas/epf/metadataTierC"}],"timestamp_created":"2020-04-09T09:16:57.098Z","timestamp_created_epoch":1586423817098,"timestamp_update":"2022-09-30T09:41:10.509Z","timestamp_update_epoch":1664530870509,"type":"IMAGE"}

children.title: Vestido
children.description: Vestido túnica negra con bordados florales en negro, rojo,rosa y azul que se combinan con estampados en rojo, azul , rosa y verde en toda la pieza. El escote de pico de la túnica esta rematado por abalorios rojos. El escote se cierra con un corchete a media altura de este. El cuello del escote esta decorado con abalorios de forma florales en rosa, dorado, blanco, azul y morado estando enmarcado en seis casetones polilobulados que se localizan alrededor de este. Las mangas  de forma rectangular y la parte baja de la pieza se encuentra rematadas en una linea lobulada de oro de iesage que enmarca unas circunferencias de abalorios violetas con un abalorio central dorado.Del remate de la manga así como de la parte baja de la pieza penden unos abalorios de forma cilindrica unidos a unas bolas de cristal. En la parte central, en el lado izquierdo se encuentra cosido una cinta de terciopelo rojo que se introduce en la parte interior del vestido a modo de cinturon.

children.title: Abito femminile da sera.
children.description: Abito di linea diritta, in chiffon di seta nero. Tagliato basso sui fianchi, da cui si staccano stretti pannelli terminanti a punta. Ricamo sul busto a cannucce di vetro nere che formano una rete interrotta da due strisce che simulano bretelle decorate ad applicazione di cannucce di vetro, perle d'argento e madreperla. Bande ricoperte di paillettes nere con una fila centrale di cristalli formano la gonna terminante con ricami che riprendono le decorazioni del busto e dei fianchi. Le bande, staccate, si aprono nel movimento per rivelare i ricami della gonna sottostante. L'abito, dalla foggia tipica degli anni Venti, presentava in origine uno scollo ancora più profondo, che è stato poi accorciato, recidendo il tessuto, all'altezza delle spalle. Da comunicazione orale della donatrice sappiamo che i ricami erano stati preparati a Milano e l'abito confezionato a Bologna dalla Sartoria Buscaroli.

Cut low at the hips, from which narrow panels end in a point. Embroidery on bust with black glass straws forming a net interrupted by two strips simulating braces decorated with glass straws, silver pearls and mother-of-pearl. Bands covered with black sequins with a central row of crystals form the skirt ending with embroidery that echoes the decorations of the bust and hips. The bands, detached, open in movement to reveal the embroidery of the skirt below. The dress, in the typical style of the 1920s, originally had an even deeper neckline, which was then shortened by cutting the fabric at shoulder level. From oral communication of the donor we know that the embroideries had been prepared in Milan and the dress made in Bologna by Sartoria Buscaroli."]},"dcTitle":{"en":["Feminine evening dress."]},"edmIsRelatedTo":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10428","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10377","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10730","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10587","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10547","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10352","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10557","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10408","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10401","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10232"]},"proxyIn":["/aggregation/aggregator/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577"],"proxyFor":"/item/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577","lineage":["/proxy/provider/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577"],"edmType":"IMAGE","europeanaProxy":false},{"about":"/proxy/provider/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577","dcCreator":{"it":["Sartoria Buscaroli","Sartoria Buscaroli, Bologna (Designer)","Paolo Bacherini, Susanna Sordi, Roberto Serafini. (Photographer)"]},"dcDate":{"it":["1925 ca."]},"dcDescription":{"it":["Abito di linea diritta, in chiffon di seta nero. Tagliato basso sui fianchi, da cui si staccano stretti pannelli terminanti a punta. Ricamo sul busto a cannucce di vetro nere che formano una rete interrotta da due strisce che simulano bretelle decorate ad applicazione di cannucce di vetro, perle d'argento e madreperla. Bande ricoperte di paillettes nere con una fila centrale di cristalli formano la gonna terminante con ricami che riprendono le decorazioni del busto e dei fianchi. Le bande, staccate, si aprono nel movimento per rivelare i ricami della gonna sottostante. L'abito, dalla foggia tipica degli anni Venti, presentava in origine uno scollo ancora più profondo, che è stato poi accorciato, recidendo il tessuto, all'altezza delle spalle. Da comunicazione orale della donatrice sappiamo che i ricami erano stati preparati a Milano e l'abito confezionato a Bologna dalla Sartoria Buscaroli."]},"dcIdentifier":{"def":["00000577"]},"dcTitle":{"it":["Abito femminile da sera."]},"dcType":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10005"],"en":["Object Type: dress"]},"dctermsCreated":{"it":["1925"]},"dctermsIsPartOf":{"en":["Europeana XX: Century of Change"]},"dctermsProvenance":{"it":["Galleria del Costume di Palazzo Pitti"]},"proxyIn":["/aggregation/provider/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577"],"proxyFor":"/item/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577","edmType":"IMAGE","europeanaProxy":false}],"qualityAnnotations":[{"about":"/item/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577#contentTier","created":"2022-10-28T08:29:45.877960Z","target":["/aggregation/provider/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577","/aggregation/aggregator/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577"],"body":"http://www.europeana.eu/schemas/epf/contentTier2"},{"about":"/item/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577#metadataTier","created":"2022-10-28T08:29:45.877995Z","target":["/aggregation/provider/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577","/aggregation/aggregator/2048224/europeana_fashion_00000577"],"body":"http://www.europeana.eu/schemas/epf/metadataTierB"}],"timestamp_created":"2020-06-17T12:55:16.639Z","timestamp_created_epoch":1592398516639,"timestamp_update":"2022-10-28T08:25:17.128Z","timestamp_update_epoch":1666945517128,"type":"IMAGE"}

children.title: Abito femminile.
children.description: Abito in satin color verde mela con spalline, scollatura ad anello. inserto a nodo che forma drappeggio sul lato destro. orlo asimmetrico. sciarpa posteriore e fiore in raso verde.

children.title: Abito femminile da sera.
children.description: Abito da sera corto senza maniche di linea sciolta in tulle di seta meccanico marrone chiaro con profondo scollo a V sul davanti, rotondo sul dietro, orlo sagomato, terminante in otto punte con profili centinati, interamente ricamato con cannucce di vetro dorate, jais dorati, celesti e rosa, perline di vetro, strass verde smeraldo e rosso rubino e filo dorato su anima di seta fissati a punto catenella.  Dettaglio della lavorazione a ricamo.

children.title: Avondjurk
children.description: The combination of beads, sequins and rhinestones and a delicate fabric, such as the transparent crêpe georgette of this evening dress exude the fashion of the Jazz Age. The dress is lined, except for the shoulders and the neck line, which are covered by only a single layer of crêpe. The low waistline of the dress is accentuated by a few turquoise beads. The graceful, vertical beading is reminiscent of a chain of abstract tulips. The radical change in the length of the hem, to just over the knee, and revealing female calves for the first time in the history of fashion, brought about a revolution. The design gives the wearer a freedom of movement that is ideal for the dances to the new music styles at the time. The play of light on the beads and sequins emphasises the movement of the body.

of Jazz Age fashion, this evening dress has a distinctive look due to the use of beads, sequins and rhinestones combined with a fragile fabric, such as transparent crepe georgette. The dress consists of two layers, except for the shoulders and the décolleté, which are only covered by a single layer of crepe. A pair of turquoise beads accentuates the dress's lowered waist. The graceful vertical bead decoration is reminiscent of abstracted tulips strung together. The knee-length design was a radical departure from established values, exposing women's calves for the first time in fashion history. The design gives the wearer freedom of movement and therefore lends itself perfectly to the dance styles that accompanied the new music styles such as jazz. The reflection of light on the sequins and beads further emphasizes the movement of the body.","Evening gown in black crêpe georgette with light green trimming, (beads) Model Worth, Paris. The dress is lined, except for the shoulders and the neck line, which are covered by only a single layer of crêpe. The low waistline of the dress is accentuated by a few turquoise beads. The graceful, vertical beading is reminiscent of a chain of abstract tulips. The radical change in the length of the hem, to just over the knee, and revealing female calves for the first time in the history of fashion, brought about a revolution. The design gives the wearer a freedom of movement that is ideal for the dances to the new music styles at the time. The play of light on the beads and sequins emphasises the movement of the body."],"nl":["Kenmerkend voor de mode uit de Jazz Age is de uitgesproken uitstraling van deze avondjurk door het gebruik van kraaltjes, pailletten en strass-stenen in combinatie met een fragiele stof, zoals hier de transparante crêpe georgette. De jurk bestaat uit twee lagen, met uitzondering van de schouders en het decolleté, die slechts bedekt zijn met een enkele laag crêpe. Een paar turquoise kralen accentueren de verlaagde taille van de jurk. De sierlijk verticale kralendecoratie doet denken aan aaneengeregen geabstraheerde tulpen. Dat de jurk tot net over de knie reikt vormde een radicale breuk met gevestigde waarden; hierdoor werden voor het eerst in de modegeschiedenis de vrouwenkuiten zichtbaar. Het ontwerp geeft de draagster veel bewegingsvrijheid en leent zich daardoor uitstekend voor de dansstijlen die gepaard gingen met de nieuwe muziekstijlen als jazz. De reflectie van het licht op de pailletten en kralen benadrukt nog eens extra de beweging van het lichaam.","Avondjapon van zwarte crêpe georgette met licht groene garnering, (kraaltjes) Model Worth, Parijs. children.title: Jurk
children.description: Charleston japon van zwarte crepe georgette, langs armsgaten, hals, onderaan en over het midden geborduurd in naturelkleur en roze met bloem- en bladrank, onderaan afgewisseld met geometrisch patroon in naturelkleur. Het borduurwerk in beige, lichtrose, rose, rode en gele zijde. zwarte zijden crêpe-georgette met tamboereerwerk in rode en gele zijde.

It is easy to carve and was often used in its natural state for jewelry, beads, amulets, and small vessels. It was also used as an ingredient in paint; dark color oil and amber varnishes are made by dissolving melted amber in amber oil, turpentine oil, or a drying oil. children.title: Dress
children.description: Φόρεμα τσάρλεστον από γκρι μουσελίνα, κεντημένο με διάφανες και ασημί χάντρες, στρας και ραφ πούλιες. Φοριέται με ομοιόχρωμο μισοφόρι με μουσελίνα στο κάτω μέρος. Ανήκε στην Έλλη Ζαλοκώστα.

children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton, 1924, No. 9, Pl. 51: Eros. Robe et manteau pour le soir, de Worth
children.description: Twee  vrouwen staan bij een zuil waarop een buste van de god Eros. De vrouw links draagt een avondjapon met sleep van Worth; de vrouw rechts een avondmantel afgezet met bont van Worth. Planche 51 uit Gazette du Bon Ton 1924, No. 9.

children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton. Art – Modes & Frivolités: Evening Attire
children.description: If the price of the Gazette du Bon Ton was steep, that of the clothes pictured was exorbitant. Evening attire was especially luxurious, consisting chiefly of silk garments decorated with gold and silver thread or expensive fur. Naturally, clothes like these called for costly accessories, which a true lady wore sparingly. An outfit had to work as a whole: all of the details, from headbands to high-heeled shoes, had to fit together. And that, in turn, required money, time, care and, most importantly, bon ton (good taste).

George"]},"dcCoverage":{"en":["first quarter 20st century"],"nl":["eerste kwart 20e eeuw"]},"dcDescription":{"en":["If the price of the Gazette du Bon Ton was steep, that of the clothes pictured was exorbitant. Evening attire was especially luxurious, consisting chiefly of silk garments decorated with gold and silver thread or expensive fur. Naturally, clothes like these called for costly accessories, which a true lady wore sparingly. An outfit had to work as a whole: all of the details, from headbands to high-heeled shoes, had to fit together. And that, in turn, required money, time, care and, most importantly, bon ton (good taste)."],"nl":["Moest men al rijk zijn om het tijdschrift Gazette du Bon Ton aan te schaffen –voor het dragen van de getoonde kleding gold dat zeker! Vooral de avondkleding was luxe uitgevoerd. Deze bestond overwegend uit zijde, versierd met goud-en zilverdraad of kostbaar bont. Hierbij hoorden natuurlijk waardevolle accessoires, die een echte dame slechts spaarzaam droeg. Het geheel moest een eenheid zijn. Alle details, van de haarband tot het hooggehakte schoentje, moesten bij elkaar passen. Daar was geld, tijd, aandacht voor nodig en, vooral, bon ton (goede smaak)."]},"dcFormat":{"def":["http://vocab.getty.edu/aat/300014109"],"en":["paper"],"nl":["papier"]},"dcIdentifier":{"def":["http://hdl.handle.net/10934/RM0001.COLLECT.498688","RP-P-2009-1955-4"]},"dcLanguage":{"def":["nl"]},"dcPublisher":{"def":["Rijksmuseum"]},"dcRights":{"def":["Public Domain","Publiek Domein"]},"dcSubject":{"def":["http://iconclass.org/41D11","http://iconclass.org/41D211(+82)","http://iconclass.org/41D2121(EVENING COAT)(+82)","http://iconclass.org/41D221(+82)","http://iconclass.org/41D2332(PUMPS)(+82)","http://iconclass.org/46C1181(+61)","http://iconclass.org/41D213(SUIT)(+81)"],"nl":["1921 - 1921"]},"dcTitle":{"en":["Gazette du Bon Ton. children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton, 1921 - No. 6, Pl. 47:  La belle dame sans merci / Robe du soir, de Worth
children.description: Vrouw voor een muurdecoratie van een phoenix. Zij draagt een avondjapon, versierd met blauw fluwelen bloemen van Worth. Planche 47 uit Gazette du Bon Ton 1921, No. 6. Uitleg over de kleding op pagina "Explication des Planches Hors-Texte. Contenues dans ce numéro."

children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton. Art- Modes & Frivolités, 1924 - No. 6 : L'Empire du monde / Robe du soir, de Worth
children.description: Staande vrouw bij een grote glazen bol, gekleed in een avondjapon met sleep, aan de zoom afgezet met bont, van Worth. Zij draagt een brede hoofdband. Planche 30 uit Gazette du Bon Ton 1924, No. 6.

children.title: Arrow of Gold Gown
children.description: This gown from the house of Poiret features an ‘arrow feather’ motif known as Yabane. This ancient Japanese pattern is still widely used on kimonos today. The plate was part of a series depicting twelve gowns created by different fashion houses and was published in the December 1925 issue of Gazette du Bon Ton. The actual dress by Poiret is preserved in the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York.

children.title: Japon
children.description:
Mouwloze geheel met kralen overdekte avondjapon. De halslijn is rond, aan de achterkant is de hals iets diper en V-vormig. Het bovenlijf is tot aan de verlaagde taille van witte dunne katoen en loopt over de rok uit in acht smalle banen die aan de onderkant rond zijn tot net boven de zoom. De rok van de japon is van zwarte dunne katoen, aan de onderkant geschulpt en is wat langer aan de achterzijde. De gehele japon is in vermicelli patroon bestikt met witte kralen. Op de taille lijn zijn zes zeer grote bloemen van zilverkleurige kralen met harten van strass steen. Dezelfde zilverkleurige kralen zijn aangebracht langs de halslijn, armsgaten en de uitlopende smalle witte banen.
Bijzondere modieuze japon.
Vanaf 1927 ging de zoom omlaag.

evening dress completely covered with beads. The neckline is round, at the back the neckline is slightly diaper and V-shaped. The bodice is made of white thin cotton up to the lowered waist and runs over the skirt in eight narrow strips that are rounded at the bottom to just above the hem. The skirt of the dress is of black thin cotton, scalloped at the bottom and is slightly longer at the back. The whole dress is stitched with white beads in a vermicelli pattern. On the waistline are six very large flowers of silver beads with hearts of rhinestone. The same silver beads are applied along the neckline, armholes and the flared narrow white stripes.\\From 1927 the hem went down."]},"dcTitle":{"en":["Dress"]},"edmIsRelatedTo":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10561","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/11079","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10730"]},"proxyIn":["/aggregation/aggregator/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317"],"proxyFor":"/item/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317","lineage":["/proxy/provider/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317"],"edmType":"IMAGE","europeanaProxy":false},{"about":"/proxy/provider/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317","dcDate":{"nl":["1927/1929"]},"dcDescription":{"nl":["Mouwloze geheel met kralen overdekte avondjapon. De halslijn is rond, aan de achterkant is de hals iets diper en V-vormig. Het bovenlijf is tot aan de verlaagde taille van witte dunne katoen en loopt over de rok uit in acht smalle banen die aan de onderkant rond zijn tot net boven de zoom. De rok van de japon is van zwarte dunne katoen, aan de onderkant geschulpt en is wat langer aan de achterzijde. De gehele japon is in vermicelli patroon bestikt met witte kralen. Op de taille lijn zijn zes zeer grote bloemen van zilverkleurige kralen met harten van strass steen. Dezelfde zilverkleurige kralen zijn aangebracht langs de halslijn, armsgaten en de uitlopende smalle witte banen.\nBijzondere modieuze japon.\nVanaf 1927 ging de zoom omlaag."]},"dcFormat":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10428"],"en":["Technique: embroidery"]},"dcIdentifier":{"def":["KA 14317"]},"dcTitle":{"nl":["Japon"]},"dcType":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10434","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10716","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10005"],"en":["Object Type: women's costume","Object Type: evening wear","Object Type: dress"],"nl":["vrouwenkleding","avondkleding","japon","avondjapon"]},"dctermsCreated":{"nl":["1927/1929"]},"dctermsIsPartOf":{"en":["Europeana XX: Century of Change"]},"dctermsMedium":{"def":["http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10354","http://thesaurus.europeanafashion.eu/thesaurus/10765"],"en":["Material: cotton","Material: bead"]},"dctermsProvenance":{"nl":["aankoop","1970"]},"proxyIn":["/aggregation/provider/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317"],"proxyFor":"/item/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317","edmType":"IMAGE","europeanaProxy":false}],"qualityAnnotations":[{"about":"/item/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317#contentTier","created":"2021-10-20T21:14:51.430371Z","target":["/aggregation/provider/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317","/aggregation/aggregator/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317"],"body":"http://www.europeana.eu/schemas/epf/contentTier1"},{"about":"/item/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317#metadataTier","created":"2021-10-20T21:14:51.430738Z","target":["/aggregation/provider/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317","/aggregation/aggregator/2048221/europeana_fashion_KA_14317"],"body":"http://www.europeana.eu/schemas/epf/metadataTierB"}],"timestamp_created":"2020-03-31T16:16:09.268Z","timestamp_created_epoch":1585671369268,"timestamp_update":"2021-10-20T13:51:01.552Z","timestamp_update_epoch":1634737861552,"type":"IMAGE"}

It is easy to carve and was often used in its natural state for jewelry, beads, amulets, and small vessels. It was also used as an ingredient in paint; dark color oil and amber varnishes are made by dissolving melted amber in amber oil, turpentine oil, or a drying oil. children.title: Frauen in Abendkleidern
children.description:
von links nach rechts:
1) schwarzer Lindener Samt, seitliche Flügelteile grau, pelzgefasst
2) schwarzes Kunstseiden-Kasackkleid mit dreifarbiger Stickerei
3) Velourchiffon-Kleid in Alpenveilchenrot, Perlenstickerei
4) Hemdkleid aus orchideefarbenem Georgettekrepp, Stickerei
Modezeichnung für "Die Dame" (Ullstein/Berlin), Heft 5, November 1924, S. 22 unter dem Titel "Abendkleider"

children.title: Dagjurk
children.description:
Jurk van witte zijde bedrukt met vierkante motieven in zwart van verschillende grootte, toenemend in grootte naar zoom van de jurk toe. Jurk met vierkante halsuitsnijding, mouwloos, verlaagde taille. Lijf en rok zijn aaneen geknipt, twee zijdnaden. Rondom 14 stolpplooien die bovenaan bij wijze van coupenaden weggestikt zijn; zij ontspringen op borsthoogte en worden op heuphoogte weer verwerkt in coupenaden; hierdoor heeft het lijfje boven een iets verlaagde taille en sterk bloezend effect. De rechthoekige motieven, die vanaf borsthoogte tot onderaan opgedrukt zijn, zijn door de coupeverwerking op de heup aldaar tot strepen gereduceerd. Behalve middenvoor zijn op deze strepen rondom 12 lusjes genaaid voor een ceintuur. De halslijn verloopt in de vorm van een omgekeerd trapezium, is echter hoog en voor laag en is rondom afgezet met een biaisbandje van zwarte zijde.
Blauw inventariskaartje: Japon van witte zijden crêpe de Chine, bedrukt met zwarte rechthoeken, die vanaf boezemhoogte naar de zoom groter worden en dichter bij elkaar gezet zijn.
Jurk van witte zijden crêpe de Chine, bedrukt met zwarte rechthoekige motieven van verschillende grootte

children.title: Abito femminile da sera.
children.description: Abito corto da sera di linea verticale senza maniche, in raso di seta nero ricamato con cannucce di varie misure e jais in vetro nei colori trasparente, argento, verde, blu, viola, nero e rosso e gocce argentate. profonda scollatura a V davanti e sul dorso. Ricamo a motivi vegetali stilizzati, piante esotiche che ricadono a fontana ad effetto di fuochi d'artificio riflessi nell'acqua, distribuito dalle spalle all'orlo con andamento speculare rispetto al centro.

children.title: Evening dress
children.description: Βραδινό κοντό φόρεμα σε στυλ τσάρλεστον από λαμέ ύφασμα, μεταποιημένο από νυφικό, που φορέθηκε από τη Σεμίρα Εμπεδοκλή στον γάμο της με τον Παντελή Βαφιαδάκη στο επί της οδού Ακαδημίας 42 σπίτι των γονιών της την 1η Ιουλίου 1926. Συνοδευτικά αντικείμενα: Αντίγραφα φωτογραφιών.

children.title: Dress
children.description: Φόρεμα σε στυλ "τσάρλεστον", αμάνικο, από μαύρο τούλι. Διακόσμηση μαύρες πούλιες, χάντρες και κεντημένα φυτικά σχέδια με χρυσοκλωστή.

children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton, 1922, No. 10, Pl. 75: Rosalinde. / Robe du soir, de Worth
children.description: Jonge vrouw, staand voor een commode, in een avondjapon van Worth van goudkleurig kant, versierd met parels.  Oorbel in het linkeroor. Planche 75 uit Gazette du Bon Ton 1922, No. 10. Uitleg over de kleding op pagina "Description et explication des planches hors-texte et pages de croquis."

children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton, 1922 - No. 9 : Sortilèges / Robe du soir, de Beer
children.description: Staande vrouw met een handspiegel in de handen, gekleed in een avondjapon met diamanten van Beer. In de oren oorbellen. In het haar een diadeem. Op de achtergrond een phoenix. Planche 66 uit Gazette du Bon Ton 1922, No. 9. Uitleg over de kleding op pagina "Description et explication des planches hors-texte et pages de croquis."

children.title: Gazette du Bon Ton, 1924 - No. 9 : Eros / Robe et manteau, pour le soir, de Worth
children.description: Twee staande vrouwen bij een zuil waarop een beeld van Eros. Zij dragen een avondjapon met sleep en een avondmantel afgezet met bont van Worth. De vrouw links heeft een roos in de hand. Planche 51 uit Gazette du Bon Ton 1924, No. 9.
